data.title: Spring Festival Web Gala greets young audience on Little New Year Day
data.meta_description: The 2020 Spring Festival Web Gala, produced by China Media Group, will meet the audience this Friday evening on TV, multiple mobile apps and web platforms, in celebration of "Little New Year Day."
data.text:
The 2020 Spring Festival Web Gala, produced by China Media Group, will meet the audience this Friday evening on CCTV-3 channel, multiple mobile apps, and web platforms, in celebration of "Little New Year Day."

Traditionally, today marks the "Little New Year Day," or "Xiaonian" in Chinese, in northern China, just a week before the Lunar New Year's eve. According to the traditional calendar, on this day, people start preparing for the New Year celebrations.

This year's gala will be a carnival for the youth full of technology and artistic creativity, hosted by popular CCTV hosts Nigemaiti Reheman, Long Yang, Gao Bo, and Yu Xiwen.

Renowned CCTV anchors Kang Hui and Zhu Guangquan are joining Reheman to present a special section called "My 2019."

The three enjoy great popularity among the Chinese audience, young and old alike, for their smart comments, earning them the name "CCTV Boys" by netizens.

The show, widely regarded as a party for youth and netizens, will also present special collaborations between celebrities and icons in different industries from all over China.

For instance, up-and-coming actor Du Jiang, who played a firefighter in the film "The Bravest," will sing the salute song of "Aspire To Glory" with the real walking-to-fire heroes from Beijing Fire Rescue Corps.
